attributes.comment:
As a U.S. citizen and the prospective father of an orphan from China, I am
writing regarding current USCIS regulations that affect the process and cost of
China adoption.

As part of the extensive adoption process, my wife and I are required to obtain
USCIS approval (form I-171H/I-797C). According to current USCIS regulations,
this approval is valid for 18 months. However, due to the lengthy wait to be
matched with a child from China, it is a certainty that every family who has a
dossier in China will experience the expiration of their (1) fingerprints (valid
for 15 months) and (2) I-171H/I-797C approval (valid for 18 months). The cost to
adoptive families of filing a new I-600A (Advance Petition to Adopt an Orphan)
will be very high, both emotionally and financially. The cost to USCIS offices
of processing new I-600As will be also be very high, in terms of time and resources.

I humbly urge you to support the following recommendations:

1)Effective immediately, increase the valid period for all newly issued
I-171H/I-797C from 18 to 24 months

2)Effective immediately, allow all families holding a valid I-171H/I-797C to
file and be approved for an extension to 24 months within 30 days after
submitting the following documents:

a.A copy of their current I-171H/I-797C and valid fingerprints
b.A Home Study update to ensure that families still qualify to adopt from China

3)Do not increase USCIS adoption-related fees

This is important because the burden of paying for and submitting a new I-600A
for a file that is already approved seems to be a frivolous and poor use of
USCIS resources. The cost to families is up to $2,000 and it seems that USCIS
offices already face heavy caseloads. Aren?t there better uses for our time and
money and the government?s time and tax revenue?

Won't you please extend the term for I-171 validity to 24 months and decrease
(or hold steady, at the current level) USCIS adoption-related fees ?

Thank you for your consideration.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by David Williams
